title: Providing for the Closing of Executive Departments and Agencies of the Federal Government on January 9, 2025

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs all federal executive departments and agencies to close on January 9, 2025, in honor of former President Jimmy Carter. However, certain offices may remain open if needed for national security, defense, or other essential public reasons, with provisions made for employee pay and leave on that day.
potential_concerns: Federal employees may face stress or confusion over which offices remain open for national security or essential reasons, affecting workforce management and morale.
Partial closures could impair government efficiency if essential functions are understaffed or disrupted due to ambiguity in implementation.
Reliance on agency heads to determine essential operations may lead to inconsistent application across departments, causing inequities among federal employees.
The limited one-day closure to honor a former president might raise concerns about precedent-setting for historical commemorations impacting government operations.
